claims.object: fibers that originate from the central nervous system and project to autonomic ganglia, where they synapse with postganglionic neurons
transmitting autonomic signals to peripheral target organs

surface_layer.definition: Fibers originating from the central nervous system projecting to autonomic ganglia where they synapse with postganglionic neurons.

deep_layer.mechanism: Action potentials travel down the fiber to the ganglion, releasing neurotransmitters that stimulate the postganglionic neuron.

citations: Preganglionic Autonomic Fiber - an overview | ScienceDirect
